message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC, cs.MM

The paper proposes a method for human activity recognition using 3D data, which involves the extraction of spatiotemporal features from joint trajectories. This falls under the domain of computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG, cs.AI). Additionally, the paper mentions the modeling of human-object interactions, which could be relevant to the sub-category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC). Finally, the use of wavelet filters for feature extraction suggests a potential connection to multimedia (cs.MM).
